passage_text: Full Definition of MALEFACTOR. 1. : one who commits an offense against the law; especially: felon. 2. : one who does ill toward another. See malefactor defined for English-language learners. See malefactor defined for kids. ADVERTISEMENT.
Noun. 1. malefactor-someone who has committed a crime or has been legally convicted of a crime. criminal, crook, felon, outlaw. accessary, accessory-someone who helps another person commit a crime.
Example Sentences Including 'malefactor'. They gave the child the surname of the malefactor and the first name of Lazarus, risen from the dead.

MALEFACTOR. mal-e-fak'-ter (kakopoios, a bad doer, i.e. evildoer, criminal; kakourgos, a wrongdoer): The former occurs in John 18:30 the King James Version, the latter, which is the stronger term, in Luke 23:32,39.
malefactor-someone who has committed a crime or has been legally convicted of a crime.
noun. A pair of malefactors. A pair of malefactors. The definition of a malefactor is a criminal or someone who does bad things. An example of a malefactor is a bank robber. an evildoer or criminal.
